lines.content: * Main entry point for the Saitama Sensei task management application.
* Handles user input, command execution, and task list coordination.
private static Storage storage = new Storage("./data/saitama.txt");
* Represents the various commands supported by Saitama Sensei.
TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, FIND, BYE, UNKNOWN
* Initializes the application, loads tasks from storage, and enters the command loop.

* Prints the confirmation message when a task is successfully added to the list.
* @param task The task that was added.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Parses the user input to determine which command to execute.
* @param input The full line of text entered by the user.
* @return The corresponding CommandType enum, or UNKNOWN if the input is invalid.
* Represents specialized exceptions that occur within the Saitama Sensei application.
* Used for handling user input errors and logic violations with custom "One Punch" messages.
* Constructs a new SaitamaException with the specified error message.
* @param message The detailed error message describing what went wrong.
* Handles the loading and saving of task data to a local file.
* This class facilitates data persistence so that tasks are not lost when the program exits.
* Constructs a Storage object with a specified file path.
* @param filePath The relative or absolute path to the data file.
* Saves the current list of tasks to the hard drive.
* If the directory does not exist, it will be created.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to be written to the file.
System.out.println("âš  Sensei encountered an error saving: " + e.getMessage());
* Loads tasks from the file specified in filePath.
* If the file does not exist, an empty task list is returned.
* @return An ArrayList containing the tasks loaded from the file.
System.out.println("âš ï¸ Sensei couldn't load the file: " + e.getMessage());
* Formats a single Task object into a string suitable for file storage.
* @param t The task to be formatted.
* @return A pipe-separated string representing the task's data.
String type = (t instanceof ToDos) ? "T" : (t instanceof Deadline) ? "D" : "E";
* Converts a string from the storage file back into a Task object.
* @param line The pipe-separated string from the data file.
* @return The corresponding Task object, or null if the format is unrecognized.
* Represents a Deadline task, which includes a specific date and time by which the task must be finished.
* Constructs a Deadline task with a description and a deadline string.
* @param description The description of the deadline.
* @param by The deadline date/time string in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm".
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task with its type identifier [D]
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
* Represents an Event task, which occurs during a specific time frame with a start and end date.
* Constructs an Event task with a description and a duration.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start date in "yyyy-MM-dd" format.
* @param to The end date in "yyyy-MM-dd" format.
public Events(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task with its type identifier [E]
* @return A formatted string representing the event task.
return "[E]" + super.toString() + " (from: " + from.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy")) + " to: " + to.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy")) + ")";
* Represents a generic task in the Saitama Sensei application.
* A task contains a description and a status indicating whether it is completed.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* The task is initialized as not done by default.
* @param description The text description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* "X" indicates the task is done, while a space " " indicates it is pending.
* @return A string representing the status icon.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task as not completed.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status icon and description.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Represents a Todo task, which is a basic task without any specific date or time.
* Constructs a Todo task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the todo.
* Returns a string representation of the Todo task with its type identifier [T].
* @return A formatted string representing the todo task.
Task result = storage.lineToTask("T | 1 | join sports club");
assertEquals("[T][ ] read book", new ToDos("read book").toString());
